H0.text: Color is the property of the mineral that the student can identify by putting it under ultraviolet light.

H1.text: Streak is the property of a mineral that can be identified when the student tests the mineral by exposing it to ultraviolet light.

H2.text: Luster is the property of the mineral that can be identified by putting it under ultraviolet light.

H3.text: Fluorescence is the property of a mineral that can be identified by a student testing it under ultraviolet light during an investigation of the mineral's properties.

A4.text: This gives the fluorescent substance a distinct color, best seen when exposed to UV light, making it appear to glow in the dark.

A5.text: Many types of calcite and amber will fluoresce under shortwave UV, longwave UV and visible light.
